sen.j: 蒲鉾（かまぼこ）は、主としてタラスケトウダラなどの白身魚のすり身を主原料とし、塩分を加えて加熱することにより、木の板（臭みのないモミ、シラベなどの木が好まれる）の上にゲル化させて製造した魚肉練り製品。
sen.e: Kamaboko, whose main ingredient is pasted whitefish such as codfish or walleye pollack, is made by mincing whitefish meat, adding salt to it, heating and turning it to a gel on a wooden board (The woods like fir trees or Abies veitchii, which have no smell, are preferred).

Kamaboko, whose main ingredient is pasted whitefish such as codfish or walleye pollack, is made by mincing whitefish meat, adding salt, heating and turning it into a gel on a wooden board (wood types such as fir or Abies veitchii, which have no odor, are preferred).

Kamaboko, whose main ingredient is pasted whitefish such as codfish or walleye pollack, is made by mincing whitefish meat, adding salt, heating and turning it into a gel on a wooden board (wood types such as fir or Abies veitchii, which have no odor, are preferred).

sen.j: カニカマ（かに風味かまぼこ）など、形状や食感などを類似させ練り上げた蒲鉾のことを「風味かまぼこ」と呼ぶ。
sen.e: The kamaboko like kanikama (crab-flavored Kamaboko), which is made by imitating real foods in forms and textures and so on, is called 'fumi kamaboko' (flavored kamaboko).
The kamaboko like kanikama (crab-flavored kamaboko), which is made by imitating real foods in forms and textures, etc., is called 'fumi kamaboko (flavored kamaboko).'
The kamaboko like kanikama (crab-flavored kamaboko), which is made by imitating real foods in forms and textures, etc., is called 'fumi kamaboko' (flavored kamaboko).
sen.cmt: 括弧の位置を訂正しました。

sen.j: 食べ方
sen.e: How to eat
How to eat it
How to eat it

sen.j: 加熱済の食品なので、薄切りにしてそのまま食べるのが普通である。
sen.e: Kamaboko is a cooked food and so is usually sliced and eaten on its own.
Kamaboko is a cooked food that is usually sliced and eaten on its own.
Kamaboko is a cooked food that is usually sliced and eaten on its own.

sen.j: 人によっては少量のわさびや醤油をつけて食べる。
sen.e: Some people eat it by dipping it in syoyu (soy sauce) and wasabi (green horseradish paste).
Some people eat it by dipping it in syoyu (soy sauce) and wasabi (green horseradish paste).
Some people eat it by dipping it in soy sauce and wasabi (green horseradish paste).
sen.cmt: 醤油の読みは不要と考え削除しました。

sen.j: これを板わさと呼び、居酒屋の他に蕎麦屋でも提供される。
sen.e: This is called 'ita-wasa' (kamaboko with wasabi) and is served in a izakaya (Japanese-style pub) or a sobaya (buckwheat noodle restaurant).
This is called 'ita-wasa (kamaboko with wasabi)' and is served in an izakaya (Japanese-style pub) or a sobaya (buckwheat-noodle restaurant).
This is called 'ita-wasa' (kamaboko with wasabi) and is served in an izakaya (Japanese-style pub) or a sobaya (buckwheat-noodle restaurant).
sen.cmt: 括弧の位置を訂正しました。

sen.j: また、切り分けるだけで調理の手間がかからないため、朝食に用いられることも多い。
sen.e: As it needs just slicing and is fuss-free, it is often served for breakfast.
As it simply requires slicing and is fuss-free, it's often served for breakfast.
As it simply requires slicing and is fuss-free, it's often served for breakfast.

sen.j: 軽く火を通して焦げ目を付けたものは生とは違った味わいがあり、酒の肴にするのも良く、また、茶碗蒸しに彩として入れることもある。
sen.e: Kamaboko, slightly toasted and browned, has a different flavor from a raw one, tastes good when drinking and is sometimes put into a chawan-musi (steamed egg hotchpotch) as a charm.

Kamaboko, slightly toasted and browned, has a slightly different flavor than the raw form; it tastes good together with beverages and is sometimes put into a chawan-musi (steamed-egg hotchpotch) as an embellishment.

Kamaboko, slightly toasted and browned, has a slightly different flavor than the raw form; it tastes good together with beverages and is sometimes put into a chawan-musi (steamed-egg hotchpotch) as an embellishment.

sen.j: 原料はスケトウダラ、（グチ）イシモチ、ニベ、イサキ、オオギス、ムツ、ハモ、サメ、イトヨリダイなどである。
sen.e: As the ingredients, kamaboko uses walleye pollack, drum, Nibe croaker, chicken grunt, big smelt-whiting, sablefish, pike conger, shirk and golden thread and so on.
For its ingredients, kamaboko uses walleye pollack, drum, Nibe croaker, chicken grunt, big smelt-whiting, sablefish, pike conger, shark, golden thread and so on.
For its ingredients, kamaboko uses walleye pollack, drum, Nibe croaker, chicken grunt, big smelt-whiting, sablefish, pike conger, shark, golden thread and so on.

sen.j: 板付き蒲鉾では白身魚の白身の部分のみを使用し、赤身や血合い肉は用いない。
sen.e: The kamaboko with a wooden board uses only the white-meat part of whitefish, but not the red-meat part or the meat that is rust-colored from blood.
The kamaboko with a wooden board uses only the white-meat part of whitefish, eschewing the red-meat part or the meat that's rust-colored due to blood.
The kamaboko with a wooden board uses only the white-meat part of whitefish, eschewing the red-meat part or the meat that's rust-colored due to blood.

sen.j: 捌いた魚の身を水で晒し、身の血液や脂肪を取り除く。
sen.e: The fish fillet is washed with running water and the blood and fat are removed.
The fish fillet is washed with running water, and the blood and fat are removed.
The fish fillet is washed with running water, and the blood and fat are removed.

sen.j: この身を石臼などですり潰し、砂糖、塩、みりん、卵白を加えて練り合わせる（本来、塩を加えて練ることで自然に粘り気が生じるのだが、後の整形をしやすくするために増粘安定剤などの食品添加物を加えることもある）。
sen.e: This fish fillet is ground by a millstone and sugar, salt, mirin (sweet cooking rice wine) and egg white are added to it and then kneaded together (Adding salt causes it sticky by itself, but sometimes food additives such as thickening agents are added for it to be molded easily).

This fish fillet is ground with a millstone, and sugar, salt, mirin (sweet cooking rice wine) and egg white are added to it and then kneaded together (adding salt causes it to become sticky by itself, but sometimes food additives such as thickening agents are added for easier molding).

This fish fillet is ground with a millstone, and sugar, salt, mirin (sweet cooking rice wine) and egg white are added to it and then kneaded together (adding salt causes it to become sticky by itself, but sometimes food additives such as thickening agents are added for easier molding).

sen.j: 板付き蒲鉾は、練り合わせた身を「手付包丁」というへら状の道具を用いて、「かまぼこ板」に半円状に盛りつける。
sen.e: In making of the kamaboko with a wooden board, spatular-shaped instruments called 'tetsuki-boucho' (a kind of kitchen knife) are used in order to put the fish-meat paste on the 'kamaboko-ita' (kamaboko's wooden board) in the form of a semicircle.

In making the kamaboko with a wooden board, spatular-shaped instruments called 'tetsuki-boucho' (a kind of kitchen knife) are used in order to put the fish-meat paste on the 'kamaboko-ita' (the wooden board for kamaboko) in the form of a semicircle.

In making the kamaboko with a wooden board, spatular-shaped instruments called 'tetsuki-boucho' (a kind of kitchen knife) are used in order to put the fish-meat paste on the 'kamaboko-ita' (the wooden board for kamaboko) in the form of a semicircle.

sen.j: 近年、量販店などで市販されているものは、ベルトコンベア上で機械的に盛りつけられることも多い。
sen.e: Recently, most of the kamaboko sold at mass retailers is automatically molded on the conveyor-belt machinery.
Today, most of the kamaboko sold at mass retailers is automatically molded on conveyor-belt machinery.
Today, most of the kamaboko sold at mass retailers is automatically molded on conveyor-belt machinery.

sen.j: その後、蒸す又は焼くことによって熱を通す。
sen.e: Then it is heated by steaming or roasting.
It is then heated by steaming or roasting.
It is then heated by steaming or roasting.

sen.j: 加熱方法の違いにより、以下のように呼び分けられる。
sen.e: It is called differently by the ways of heating as follows.
It is given one of various names according to the way it's heated, as follows:
It is given one of various names according to the way it's heated, as follows:

sen.j: - すり身を蒸して加熱したもの。
sen.e: The fish-meat paste is heated by steaming.
The fish-meat paste is heated by steaming.
The fish-meat paste is heated by steaming.

sen.j: - 蒸さずに板の下からあぶり焼きにして加熱したもの。
sen.e: The fish-meat paste is roasted from under the wooden board without steaming.
The fish-meat paste is roasted from under the wooden board without being steamed.
The fish-meat paste is roasted from under the wooden board without being steamed.

sen.j: 「焼通しかまぼこ」という名称で呼ばれる地域もある。
sen.e: It is called 'yakitoshi kamaboko' in some areas.
In some areas it's called 'yakitoshi kamaboko.'
In some areas it's called 'yakitoshi kamaboko.'

sen.j: 板に盛りつけず、そのまま成形し、蒸し・焼きの他に茹で・揚げ等で加熱されるものがある。
sen.e: Some kamabokos molded without putting its fish-meat paste on the wooden board is heated by boiling or frying as well as steaming and roasting.
Some kamaboko, which is molded without putting its fish-meat paste on the wooden board, is heated by boiling or frying as well as steaming and roasting.
Some kamaboko, which is molded without putting its fish-meat paste on the wooden board, is heated by boiling or frying as well as steaming and roasting.

sen.j: 茹でたものはが半片やつみれに、揚げたものが薩摩揚げ（西日本では天ぷらとも呼ばれる）などとなる。
sen.e: Boiled kamaboko is called 'hanpen' or 'tsumire' and fried one is 'Satsuma-age' (in western Japan 'tenpura').
Boiled kamaboko is called 'hanpen' or 'tsumire,' and the fried version is called 'Satsuma-age' (in western Japan it's 'tenpura').
Boiled kamaboko is called 'hanpen' or 'tsumire,' and the fried version is called 'Satsuma-age' (in western Japan it's 'tenpura').

sen.j: これらも広義の蒲鉾の一つといえよう。
sen.e: These are also categorized into kamaboko in the broad sense.
In the broad sense, these are categorized as kamaboko.
In the broad sense, these are categorized as kamaboko.

sen.j: かまぼこの歯応えは「足（あし）」と呼ばれ、かまぼこの商品価値を左右する。
sen.e: The texture of kamaboko is called 'ashi' (foot) and determines the commercial value.
The texture of kamaboko, called 'ashi (foot),' determines its commercial value.
The texture of kamaboko, called 'ashi' (foot), determines its commercial value.
sen.cmt: 括弧の位置を訂正しました。

sen.j: この「足」は、魚肉の筋原繊維を構成するミオシンのS-S結合（ジスルフィド結合）が、関与している。
sen.e: This 'ashi' relates to S-S bond (disulfide bond) in myosin that makes up the muscle fiber in fish-meat.
This 'ashi' relates to the S-S bond (disulfide bond) in myosin, which makes up the muscle fiber in fish meat.
This 'ashi' relates to the S-S bond (disulfide bond) in myosin, which makes up the muscle fiber in fish meat.

sen.j: 板（蒲鉾板、あるいは空板（からいた）と呼ばれる）の上に半円形にすり身を盛り付けて作った「板蒲鉾」が一般的であるが、地方によって特色がある。
sen.e: In general, kamaboko is made by putting the fish-meat paste on the wooden board ('ita', 'kamaboko- ita' or 'kara-ita') in the form of a semicircle, but the products vary provincially.
Generally, kamaboko is made by putting the fish-meat paste on the wooden board ('ita,' 'kamaboko- ita' or 'kara-ita') in the form of a semicircle, but the products vary from one province to another.
Generally, kamaboko is made by putting the fish-meat paste on the wooden board ('ita,' 'kamaboko- ita' or 'kara-ita') in the form of a semicircle, but the products vary from one province to another.

sen.j: 細工蒲鉾
sen.e: Saiku kamaboko (ornamental kamanoko)
Saiku kamaboko (ornamental kamanoko)
Saiku kamaboko (ornamental kamanoko)

sen.j: 鯛や水引などの形に蒲鉾を整形したもの。
sen.e: This type of kamaboko is the one that is molded in the form of 'tai' (sea bream) or 'mizuhiki' (ornamental strings) and so on.
This type of kamaboko is the one that is molded in the form of 'tai' (sea bream) or 'mizuhiki' (ornamental strings) and so on.
This type of kamaboko is the one that is molded in the form of 'tai' (sea bream) or 'mizuhiki' (ornamental strings) and so on.

sen.j: 結婚式の引出物など冠婚葬祭の引出物として作られている。
sen.e: It is made as a 'hikidemono' (a gift given at the ceremonial functions like wedding).
It is made as a 'hikidemono' (a gift given at a ceremonial function such as a wedding).
It is made as a 'hikidemono' (a gift given at a ceremonial function such as a wedding).

sen.j: 本格的なものは、鯛型で実物大程度の大きさがある。
sen.e: The authentic ones are full-sized in the form of 'tai'.
The authentic ones are full-sized in the form of 'tai.'
The authentic ones are full-sized in the form of 'tai.'

sen.j: また、松竹梅の形にし、縁起物としても作られている。
sen.e: And also they are made in the form of 'sho-tiku-bai' (pine, bamboo, and plum) as auspicious objects.
Additionally, they're made in the form of 'sho-tiku-bai (pine, bamboo and plum)' as auspicious objects.
Additionally, they're made in the form of 'sho-tiku-bai' (pine, bamboo and plum) as auspicious objects.
sen.cmt: 括弧の位置を訂正しました。

sen.j: 島根の大社地方を中心に古くから作り伝えられてきた細工蒲鉾は、婚礼（披露宴）の引出物として有名である。
sen.e: Saiku kamoboko in Oyashiro region in Shimane prefecture has a long tradition and is famous for the 'hikidemono' for weddings.
Saiku kamoboko in the Oyashiro region of Shimane Prefecture has a long tradition and is famous for the 'hikidemono' used for weddings.

sen.j: 他に富山県や舞鶴市のものが知られる。
sen.e: The ones in Toyama prefecture and Maizuru city are also famous.
The ones in Toyama Prefecture and Maizuru City are also famous.

sen.j: はべん
sen.e: Haben'

sen.j: 富山県で作られるかまぼこの総称。
sen.e: It is a general term for the kamaboko made in Toyama prefecture.
It is a general term for the kamaboko made in Toyama Prefecture.

sen.j: 板状にしたすり身をだし巻き卵のように巻いて作った物が主流であり、板付きのものはほとんど見られない。
sen.e: This type of kamoboko is made by rolling the fish-meat paste in the form of a sheet like a 'dasimaki-tamago' (soup-flavored rolled egg) and the one with wooden board is very rare.
This type of kamoboko is made by rolling the fish-meat paste in the form of a sheet like a 'dasimaki-tamago (soup-flavored rolled egg),' but the one with a wooden board is very rare.

sen.j: 種類としては、コンブを巻き込んだ「昆布巻」（こぶまき）、鳴門巻きに似た「赤巻」（あかまき）などがある。
sen.e: It has the varieties such as the one which rolls 'konbu or kobu' (kelp) into the product called 'kobu-maki' (kelp roll) or the one called 'aka-maki' (red roll) similar to 'naruto-maki' (naruto roll).
sen.cmt: 鳴門巻きや赤巻の説明があればベターだと思いますが。。
sen.e: There are varieties such as the one that rolls 'konbu or kobu' (kelp) into the product called 'kobu-maki (kelp roll)' or the one called 'aka-maki (red roll)' similar to 'naruto-maki (naruto roll).'

sen.j: 笹かまぼこ
sen.e: Sasa kamoboko (bamboo-grass kamaboko)
Sasa kamoboko (bamboo-grass kamaboko)
Sasa kamoboko (bamboo-grass kamaboko)

sen.j: その形状から、元は「木の葉かまぼこ」「手のひらかまぼこ」「平かまぼこ」「舌かまぼこ」などと呼ばれていた。
sen.e: Originally, according to the shape, it was called 'konoha kamoboko' (leaf kamaboko), 'te-no-hira kamaboko' (palm kamaboko), 'hira kamaboko' (flat kamaboko) or 'sita kamaboko' (tongue kamaboko).
Originally, it was called 'konoha kamoboko' (leaf kamaboko), 'te-no-hira kamaboko' (palm kamaboko), 'hira kamaboko' (flat kamaboko) or 'sita kamaboko' (tongue kamaboko) according to its shape.
Originally, it was called 'konoha kamoboko' (leaf kamaboko), 'te-no-hira kamaboko' (palm kamaboko), 'hira kamaboko' (flat kamaboko) or 'sita kamaboko' (tongue kamaboko) according to its shape.

sen.j: 仙台市一番町 (仙台市)に1935年（昭和10年）創業した阿部蒲鉾において、旧仙台藩主伊達氏の家紋「竹に雀」のササに因んで「笹かまぼこ」と呼ぶようになってから、旧仙台藩地域で次第に名称が統一されていったという。
sen.e: ABE Kamaboko company, which had started a business in Sendai city Ichiban-cho in 1935, named it 'sasa kamaboko' after the family crest 'take ni suzumi' (sparrows with bamboos) of Mr. DATE who was the former lord of the Sendai clan, and after that, the name was gradually unified in the former Sendai clan area.

The ABE Kamaboko company, which had started a business in Sendai City's Ichiban-cho in 1935, called it 'sasa kamaboko' after the family crest 'take ni suzumi' (sparrows with bamboo) of Mr. DATE, who was the former lord of the Sendai clan; subsequently, the name was gradually unified in the area of the former Sendai clan.

The Abe Kamaboko Company, which had started a business in Ichiban-cho, Sendai City in 1935, called it 'sasa kamaboko' after the family crest 'take ni suzume' (sparrows with bamboo) of the Date clan, the former lord of the Sendai Domain; subsequently, the name was gradually unified in the area of the former Sendai Domain.
sen.cmt: Abeに訂正しました。Company大文字にしました。in Ichiban-cho, Sendai City に訂正しました。suzumeに訂正しました。the Date clanに訂正しました。who was 削除しました。Sendai Domainに訂正しました。

sen.j: 現在では「笹かま」との省略形でも通用する。
sen.e: Now, the shortened form 'sasa kama' is also comprehensible.
Today, the shortened form 'sasa kama' is also comprehensible.
Today, the shortened form 'sasa kama' is also comprehensible.

sen.j: 支店経済都市である仙台市の仙台駅で土産品としての地位を確立したため、全国的には「仙台市の特産品」との認識もあるが、名称の由来からも「旧仙台藩の特産品」である（→仙台参照）。
sen.e: As it achieved the considerable market position as a souvenir sold at the Sendai station in Sendai city which was a Shiten-Keizai toshi (the economically-developed city where the branch firms or subsidiary firms converge), it is regarded as a 'local product in Sendai city' nationwide, but when considering the origin of the name (see Sendai), it is a 'local product of the former Sendai clan'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As it achieved a considerable market position as a souvenir sold at Sendai Station in Sendai City, which was a Shiten-Keizai toshi (an economically developed city where the branch firms or subsidiary firms converge), it is regarded nationally as a 'local product in Sendai City'; however, when considering the origin of the name (see 'Sendai') it's a 'local product of the former Sendai clan.'

As it achieved a considerable market position as a souvenir sold at Sendai Station in Sendai City, which was a Shiten-Keizai toshi (an economically developed city where the branch firms or subsidiary firms converge), it is regarded nationally as a 'local product in Sendai City'; however, when considering the origin of the name (see 'Sendai') it's a 'local product of the former Sendai Domain.'

sen.j: 特定第3種漁港（全国的重要漁港）を擁する気仙沼市・石巻市・塩竈市のほか、宮城県内の太平洋沿岸の港町でも生産は多い。
sen.e: Thus, the production is high also in Kesennuma city, Ishimaki city, Shiogama city, which has Tokutei Daisanshu Gyoko (the specific third-kind fishing port or nationally important fishing port), or the seaports on the Pacific side in Miyagi prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Thus the level of production is also high in Kesennuma City, Ishimaki City, Shiogama City, which has Tokutei Daisanshu Gyoko (a specific third-kind fishing port or nationally important fishing port), or the seaports on the Pacific side in Miyagi Prefecture.

Thus the level of production is also high in Kesennuma City, Ishinomaki City, Shiogama City, which has Tokutei Daisanshu Gyoko (a specific third-kind fishing port or nationally important fishing port), or the seaports on the Pacific side in Miyagi Prefecture.

sen.j: なお、阿部蒲鉾との違いを出すため、現在も「手のひらかまぼこ」の商品名を用いる企業もある。
sen.e: Some companies now also use the trade name 'te-no-hira kamaboko' to differentiate themselves from ABE Kamaboko.
Some companies now also use the trade name 'te-no-hira kamaboko' in order to differentiate themselves from ABE Kamaboko.
Some companies now also use the trade name 'te-no-hira kamaboko' in order to differentiate themselves from Abe Kamaboko.

sen.j: 現在の製法は、笹形の木枠あるいは鉄製枠にすり身を入れておおよそを成型し、贈答品などではその後手で細かな成形をする工程を入れて、竹串に刺して焼いて作られる。
sen.e: In the current process of making, fish-meat paste is roughly molded in the wooden or iron frame in the form of bamboo leaf, put on a bamboo skewer and roasted, however, as gift items, the delicate molding by hand is added to the paste.

In the current production process, fish-meat paste is roughly molded in the wooden or iron frame in the form of a bamboo leaf, placed on a bamboo skewer and roasted; however, as a gift item the paste is delicately molded by hand.

In the current production process, fish-meat paste is roughly molded in the wooden or iron frame in the form of a bamboo leaf, placed on a bamboo skewer and roasted; however, as a gift item the paste is delicately molded by hand.

sen.j: 焼きかまぼこ
sen.e: Yaki kamaboko (roasted kamaboko)
Yaki kamaboko (roasted kamaboko)
Yaki kamaboko (roasted kamaboko)

sen.j: 関西地方に多いかまぼこ。
sen.e: This type of kamaboko is common in the Kansai region.
This type of kamaboko is common in the Kansai region.
This type of kamaboko is common in the Kansai region.

sen.j: 厚みを低く抑えた蒸しかまぼこの表面に、焼き目を付けたもの。
sen.e: It is a kind of musi kamaboko (steamed Kamaboko), which is not so thick and has a browned surface.
It's a kind of musi kamaboko (steamed kamaboko), which isn't as thick but has a browned surface.
It's a kind of musi kamaboko (steamed kamaboko), which isn't as thick but has a browned surface.

sen.j: 焼き板かまぼことも言う。
sen.e: It is sometimes called a 'yaki-ita kamaboko' (roasted kamaboko with a wooden board).
It's sometimes called a 'yaki-ita kamaboko (roasted kamaboko with a wooden board).'
It's sometimes called a 'yaki-ita kamaboko' (roasted kamaboko with a wooden board).
sen.cmt: 括弧の位置を訂正しました。

sen.j: 上記の焼き抜きかまぼこには該当しない。
sen.e: This is different from the above-mentioned 'yakinuki kamaboko' (roasted kamaboko).
This is different from the previously mentioned 'yakinuki kamaboko (roasted kamaboko).'
This is different from the previously mentioned 'yakinuki kamaboko' (roasted kamaboko).

sen.j: 削りかまぼこ
sen.e: Kezuri kamaboko (scraped kamaboko)
Kezuri kamaboko (scraped kamaboko)
Kezuri kamaboko (scraped kamaboko)

sen.j: 八幡浜市周辺など南伊予地方で食べられている。
sen.e: This type of kamaboko is eaten in the Minami-Iyo region around Yawata-hama city.
This type of kamaboko is eaten in the Minami-Iyo region around Yawata-hama City.
This type of kamaboko is eaten in the south Iyo region around Yawatahama City.
sen.cmt: in the south Iyo regionに訂正しました。ハイフンを削除し、Yawatahamaとしました。

sen.j: 戦前、日持ちの悪かった蒲鉾を乾燥させ日持ちさせたものを削り食したことから由来。
sen.e: Originally, in the prewar era, as the kamaboko did not have good keeping quality, people dried it to keep good and ate it by scraping.
Originally, in the prewar era, because the kamaboko didn't keep well, people dried it as a means of preservation and would scrape off portions of it to eat.
Originally, in the prewar era, because the kamaboko didn't keep well, people dried it as a means of preservation and would scrape off portions of it to eat.

sen.j: 古くは材料を竹の棒に筒状に巻いて作った。
sen.e: It used to be made by rolling the paste around the bamboo stick in the tubular form.
It used to be made by rolling the paste around the bamboo stick in a tubular form.
It used to be made by rolling the paste around the bamboo stick in a tubular form.

sen.j: その形が蒲（がま）の穂に似ていることから、「蒲鉾」と呼ばれるようになったとされる。
sen.e: As the shape was similar to the ear of 'gama' (cattail), it is said to have been called 'kamaboko'.
As the shape was similar to the ear of 'gama' (cattail), it is said to have been called 'kamaboko.'
As the shape was similar to the ear of 'gama' (cattail), it is said to have been called 'kamaboko.'

sen.j: 竹を抜き去ると現在の竹輪の形になる。
sen.e: Removing the bamboo stick from the paste, you can see the current form of chikuwa (fish sauage in the form of bamboo cylinder).
Removing the bamboo stick from the paste, one can see the current form of chikuwa (fish sausage in the form of a bamboo cylinder).
Removing the bamboo stick from the paste, one can see the current form of chikuwa (fish sausage in the form of a bamboo cylinder).

sen.j: 後に板の上に成形した「板蒲鉾」が登場し、区別のために「竹輪蒲鉾」と呼び分けていた。
sen.e: As the 'ita kamaboko' molded on the wooden board appeared later, it was distinctly called 'chikuwa kamaboko'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Because the 'ita kamaboko' molded on the wooden board appeared later, it was distinctly called 'chikuwa kamaboko.'
Because the 'ita kamaboko' molded on the wooden board appeared later, it was distinctly called 'chikuwa kamaboko.'

sen.j: しかし、元祖の方は「蒲鉾」が脱落して単に「ちくわ」となり、板蒲鉾の方は逆に板が外れて「蒲鉾」になった。
sen.e: However, while the original one lost the name 'kamaboko' and came to be called simply 'chikuwa', 'ita kamaboko' lost the 'ita' and came to be called 'kamaboko'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, while the original one lost the name 'kamaboko' and came to be called simply 'chikuwa,' 'ita kamaboko' lost the 'ita' and came to be called 'kamaboko.'
However, while the original one lost the name 'kamaboko' and came to be called simply 'chikuwa,' 'ita kamaboko' lost the 'ita' and came to be called 'kamaboko.'

sen.j: 平安時代の『類聚雑要抄』には藤原忠実が永久3年（1115年）に転居祝いに宴会を開いた時の串を刺したかまぼこが載っている。
sen.e: There is the description of the kamaboko put on a bamboo skewer served when FUJIWARA no Tadazane held a feast to celebrate his move to a new house in 1115 in 'Ruijuzatsuyosho' (the tome which dealt with traditional ceremony, costume and so on) written in the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 『類聚雑要抄』の説明ですが、もっと良いものがあるかもしれません。
sen.e: There is the description of the kamaboko placed on a bamboo skewer, which was served when FUJIWARA no Tadazane held a feast to celebrate his move to a new house in 1115 in 'Ruijuzatsuyosho' (the tome that dealt with traditional ceremonies, costumes and so on), written in the Heian period.

There is the description of the kamaboko placed on a bamboo skewer, which was served when FUJIWARA no Tadazane held a feast to celebrate his move to a new house in 1115 in 'Ruijuzatsuyosho' (the tome that dealt with traditional ceremonies, costumes and so on), written in the Heian period.

sen.j: これを確認できる最古の文献上のかまぼこであるとして、業界団体がその数字をとって11月15日を蒲鉾の日としている。
sen.e: The industry group designates November 15 (1115) as Kamaboko Day because at the moment the date is regarded as the oldest date when kamaboko appeared in the literature.
The industry group designates November 15 (1115) as Kamaboko Day because, currently, the date is regarded as the oldest date on which kamaboko appeared in the literature.
The industry group designates November 15 (1115) as Kamaboko Day because, currently, the date is regarded as the oldest date on which kamaboko appeared in the literature.

sen.j: 白身の魚は高価であり、蒲鉾もご馳走と考えられた。
sen.e: White fish was expensive and so kamaboko was thought to be a delicacy.
Whitefish was expensive, so kamaboko was considered a delicacy.
Whitefish was expensive, so kamaboko was considered a delicacy.

sen.j: 時に贈答品として用いられ、おせち料理にも利用される。
sen.e: Sometimes it is used as a gift item or in 'osechi ryori' (New Year dishes).
Sometimes it is used as a gift item or in 'osechi ryori' (New Year's dishes).
Sometimes it is used as a gift item or in 'osechi ryori' (New Year's dishes).

sen.j: 豊臣秀頼の大好物であったと伝えられ、本能寺での信長の最後の晩餐にも供された。
sen.e: Allegedly, it was a great favorite of Hideyori TOYOTOMI and served at Nobunaga ODA's last supper in Honnoji Temple.
Allegedly, it was a great favorite of Hideyori TOYOTOMI and was served at Nobunaga ODA's last supper in Honnoji Temple.
Allegedly, it was a great favorite of Hideyori TOYOTOMI and was served at Nobunaga ODA's last supper in Honno-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: Honno-ji ハイフン補足しました。

sen.j: なお、かまぼこが商品として販売されるようになったのは江戸時代以降とされる。
sen.e: It is said that kamaboko was first sold as a commercial product in the Edo period or later.
It is said that kamaboko was first sold as a commercial product during the Edo period or later.
It is said that kamaboko was first sold as a commercial product during the Edo period or later.

sen.j: 蒲鉾の生産量が日本で最も多いのは宮城県であり、全国シェアの10%を占める（宮城県食産業振興課発表）。
sen.e: Miyagi prefecture produces the largest amount of kamaboko in Japan and accounts for 10 percent of the market share nationwide (according to the promotion department of food industry in Miyagi prefecture).

Miyagi Prefecture produces the largest amount of kamaboko in Japan, accounting for ten percent of the market share nationwide (according to the Promotion Department of Food Industry in Miyagi Prefecture).

Miyagi Prefecture produces the largest amount of kamaboko in Japan, accounting for ten percent of the market share nationwide (according to the Promotion Department of Food Industry in Miyagi Prefecture).

sen.j: 焼きちくわ、揚げ蒲鉾の分野でも全国最大の生産量を誇る。
sen.e: Miyagi prefecture is also the top of the country in the production of 'yaki chikuwa' (roasted chikuwa) and 'age kamaboko' (fried kamaboko).
Miyagi Prefecture also leads the nation in the production of 'yaki chikuwa (roasted chikuwa)' and 'age kamaboko (fried kamaboko).'
Miyagi Prefecture also leads the nation in the production of 'yaki chikuwa' (roasted chikuwa) and 'age kamaboko' (fried kamaboko).

sen.j: また、蒲鉾の消費量が最も多いのも宮城県である。
sen.e: Also, Miyagi prefecture consumes the largest amount of kamaboko in Japan.
Moreover, Miyagi Prefecture leads Japan in the consumption of kamaboko.

sen.j: この背景として、文化的には宮城県の名産品「笹かまぼこ」の存在が影響している。
sen.e: That is because there is a cultural influence of the specialty 'sasa kamaboko' in Miyagi prefecture.
This is due to the cultural influence of the specialty food 'sasa kamaboko' in Miyagi Prefecture.

sen.j: 産業的には、日本の漁港一覧であり、気仙沼漁港、石巻漁港、塩釜漁港のような大規模な特定第3種漁港の存在と、関連する水産加工業の発達が影響している。
sen.e: From an industrial viewpoint, as in the list of the fishing ports in Japan, there is an influence of the large scale Tokutei Daisansyu Gyoko such as Kesennuma fishing port, Ishimaki fishing port and Shiogama fishing port, and the development of the related marine product processing industries.
sen.cmt: 「漁港一覧であり」は日本語として意味不明なので「漁港一覧にあるように」と言い換えました。
sen.e: From an industrial viewpoint, as in the list of fishing ports in Japan, there is the influence of the large-scale Tokutei Daisansyu Gyoko such as the fishing ports of Kesennuma, Ishimaki and Shiogama, as well as the development of related marine-product processing industries.

From an industrial viewpoint, as in the list of fishing ports in Japan, there is the influence of the large-scale Tokutei Daisansyu Gyoko such as the fishing ports of Kesennuma, Ishinomaki and Shiogama, as well as the development of related marine-product processing industries.

sen.j: なお、蒲鉾の生産高トップの会社は、東京都に所在する紀文食品である。
sen.e: The company which produces the largest amount of kamaboko is Kibun-syokuhin (Kibun Foods, Inc.) located in Tokyo city.

sen.j: 俗にいう「かまとと」（かまとと振り）とは「かまぼこのことを『これは魚（とと）か』と聞く」ということから、無知・世間知らずを装ってかわいらしく見せる人（特に女性）を指す。
sen.e: So-called 'kamatoto' (kamatoto-buri, pretending kamatoto) refers to the person (especially a woman) who tries to look cute by pretending to be ignorant or naïve, where he/she sees kamaboko and asks, 'Is this fish ('toto')?'

So-called 'kamatoto' (kamatoto-buri, or feigning kamatoto) refers to the person (especially a woman) who tries to look cute by pretending to be ignorant or naïve, where he/she sees kamaboko and asks, 'Is this fish (toto)?'

So-called 'kamatoto' (kamatoto-buri, or feigning kamatoto) refers to the person (especially a woman) who tries to look cute by pretending to be ignorant or naïve, where he/she sees kamaboko and asks, 'Is this fish (toto)?'

sen.j: 江戸時代に遊女が世間知らずを装うため、蒲鉾を指してこれが魚なのかと問うたことに由来するといわれる。
sen.e: It is said to originate from that the prostitutes in the Edo period, pointing at kamaboko, asked whether that is fish, pretending to be naïve.
It is said to originate from the prostitutes in the Edo period, pointing at kamaboko, who would ask whether it was fish, pretending to be naïve.
It is said to originate from the prostitutes in the Edo period, pointing at kamaboko, who would ask whether it was fish, pretending to be naive.

sen.j: 線路 (鉄道)が周囲より高い場所または低い場所に設けられた踏切は、極端に盛り上がったり窪んだ形状になるため、かまぼこ型踏切といわれる。
sen.e: The railroad crossing, where the rail tracks are put on the higher or lower place than the surrounding area, is called 'kamaboko-gata (style) railroad crossing', because the shapes are extremely swollen or depressed.

The railroad crossing in which the rail tracks are placed at a higher or lower level than the surrounding area, is called a 'kamaboko-gata (style) railroad crossing,' because the shapes are extremely swollen or depressed.

The railroad crossing in which the rail tracks are placed at a higher or lower level than the surrounding area, is called a 'kamaboko-gata (style) railroad crossing,' because the shapes are extremely swollen or depressed.

sen.j: 軍隊の駐屯地等に設置されたでアーチ状の兵舎のことがその形状からかまぼこ兵舎と呼ばれる場合がある。
sen.e: The arch-like barracks set up in military garrison and so on are sometimes called 'kamaboko barracks' from its resemblance to kamaboko.
The arch-like barracks set up in military garrisons and so on are sometimes called 'kamaboko barracks' due to their resemblance to kamaboko.
The arch-like barracks set up in military garrisons and so on are sometimes called 'kamaboko barracks' due to their resemblance to kamaboko.

sen.j: オーディオにおいて、低音域と高音域が小さく、中音域が強調された音づくりをさしてカマボコ型という。
sen.e: The audio instruments, which emphasize the middle-pitched sound but tones down the high-pitched and low-pitched one in their sound design, are called 'kamaboko gata' (kamaboko style).
Audio components that emphasize the midrange frequencies over high or low frequencies in their designs are called 'kamaboko-gata (kamaboko style).'
Audio components that emphasize the midrange frequencies over high or low frequencies in their designs are called 'kamaboko-gata' (kamaboko style).
sen.cmt: 括弧の位置を訂正しました。

sen.j: いわゆるドンシャリの反対である。
sen.e: Their sound design is opposite to that of so-called 'Don Shari' (Don refers to low-pitched sound and Shari to high-pitched one).
Their sound design is opposite to that of so-called 'Don Shari' ('don' refers to low-pitched sound and 'shari' refers to high-pitched sound).
Their sound design is opposite to that of so-called 'Don Shari' ('don' refers to low-pitched sound and 'shari' refers to high-pitched sound).

sen.j: 警察機動隊の常駐警備車のこと。
sen.e: It also refers to the security vehicles of the riot police.
It also refers to the security vehicles of riot police.
It also refers to the security vehicles of riot police.

sen.j: 初期の車は板蒲鉾状だったことから。
sen.e: That is because the early vehicles were shaped like ita kamaboko.
That is because the early vehicles were shaped like ita kamaboko.
That is because the early vehicles were shaped like ita kamaboko.

sen.j: ボウリングでレーンオイルの乗り方が、レーン中央が厚め（滑りやすい）で左右が薄め（滑りにくい）の状態のことを「カマボコ型」と呼ぶ。
sen.e: In bowling, when the lane oil is spread thickly on the central lane (slippery) and thinly on both sides of the lane (not slippery), this is called 'kamaboko gata' (kamaboko style).
In bowling, when the lane oil is spread thickly on the central lane (slippery) and thinly toward the edges of the lane (not slippery), it's called 'kamaboko-gata (kamaboko style).'
In bowling, when the lane oil is spread thickly on the central lane (slippery) and thinly toward the edges of the lane (not slippery), it's called 'kamaboko-gata' (kamaboko style).
